com.openfeint.api
Class OpenFeint

java.lang.Object
  com.openfeint.api.OpenFeint

public class OpenFeint
extends java.lang.Object

Shared entry point for initializing OpenFeint and getting access to its current state.

Constructor Detail

OpenFeint

public OpenFeint()
Method Detail

getCurrentUser

public static CurrentUser getCurrentUser()
Get the currently logged-in user. Returns null if no user has logged in, or if they've logged out.

Returns:
The currently logged-in user.

isUserLoggedIn

public static boolean isUserLoggedIn()
Get whether a user is currently logged in or not.

Returns:
whether a user is currently logged in or not.

initialize

public static void initialize(Context ctx,
                              OpenFeintSettings settings,
                              OpenFeintDelegate delegate)
Initialize OpenFeint. This will allocate OpenFeint internal structures the first time it's called, and start the login process for the local user. This must be called before any other OpenFeint methods can be called (or see initializeWithoutLoggingIn).

Parameters:
ctx - Application Context.
settings - An instance of OpenFeintSettings providing OpenFeint with information about your application.
delegate - An instance derived from OpenFeintDelegate, for future event notifications. null is ok.

initializeWithoutLoggingIn

public static void initializeWithoutLoggingIn(Context ctx,
                                              OpenFeintSettings settings,
                                              OpenFeintDelegate delegate)
Initialize OpenFeint. This will allocate OpenFeint internal structures the first time it's called, but won't start the login process for the local user. Note that you must call login(currentActivity) before any requests that require login may be used.

Parameters:
ctx - Application Context.
settings - An instance of OpenFeintSettings providing OpenFeint with information about your application.
delegate - An instance derived from OpenFeintDelegate, for future event notifications. null is ok.

setDelegate

public static void setDelegate(OpenFeintDelegate delegate)
Update the OpenFeint delegate. This will notify OpenFeint that further events should be forwarded to the new delegate. Calling this with null will clear any existing delegate - be sure to do this if your delegate closes over an Activity when you leave that Activity, so that it can be garbage-collected. An example of when you would want to use this is if you only care about login events in your main menu Activity - then you would call {#link initializeWithoutLoggingIn} from your Application, then call setDelegate in your main menu Activity's onCreate method, before finally calling login.

Parameters:
delegate - An instance derived from OpenFeintDelegate, for future event notifications. null is ok.

login

public static void login()
Login to OpenFeint. This should only be called after initializeWithoutLoggingIn, and should only be called once.

isNetworkConnected

public static boolean isNetworkConnected()
Determine if the device can connect to the Internet. If this is false, OpenFeint will not be able to use its online functionality.

userApprovedFeint

public static void userApprovedFeint()
If you have a custom intro flow, call this method if the user approves Feint. Call userDeclinedFeint() if they decline it.

userDeclinedFeint

public static void userDeclinedFeint()
If you have a custom intro flow, call this method if the user declines Feint. Call userApprovedFeint() if they approve it.

logoutUser

public static void logoutUser()
Call this method to log out the local user.

trySubmitOfflineData

public static void trySubmitOfflineData()
Call this method to try to submit the offline achievement and score records. Note that in general, you are not responsible for calling this - OpenFeint will automatically try to submit the offline data when logging in the user or opening the dashboard. However, if you have your own in-game achivement or leaderboard display, you may want to call this before opening them, to try to keep the data up-to-date.

onPause

public static void onPause()

onResume

public static void onResume()

onExit

public static void onExit()
